info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 6 at 6:32AM EDT until June 7 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River at Newberry and Edwardsport
Mississinewa River near Ridgeville.
Wabash River at Lafayette.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
Wildcat Creek near Lafayette.
White River at Elliston.
.Rainfall amounts of two to four inches across central Indiana is producing minor flooding along area waterways in west-central Indiana. Flooding is ongoing along Wildcat Creek and the Mississinewa River with flooding along the Wabash and White expected to begin today. Additional rainfall of one to two inches is possible over the White River basin through Sunday.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River at Newberry.
* WHEN...From this morning to late tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding of a few lowlands begins in Greene County.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM EDT Friday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 AM EDT Friday was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage to 12.9 feet this morning. It will then rise above flood stage late this morning to 13.1 feet this afternoon. It will fall below flood stage again late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this evening by around 600 PM EDT /500 PM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE TONIGHT

area.areaDesc: Daviess, IN; Greene, IN; Knox, IN
